text: Purchased in Vermont, Easter 2017. Pours a hazy golden-amber colour with a creamy white cap and very good retention. Light sweet nose from the Belgian Ale yeast and oatmeal. Citrus notes and other fruity malts. This fruitiness continues in the flavours with some nice grass in the finish to give some dry bitterness. Mild spices and a soda water feel. A complex brew, but a little too rich to enjoy such a bit bottle.

750 ml corked and crowned bottle. Pours a hazy honey gold color topped by a massive frothy beige head. Light fruity, yeasty lemon peel aroma. Big bitter grainy malt flavor upfront. Yeasty, earthy, minerally notes. Tart and refreshing. Middle smoothes out and becomes wheat-like and citrusy. Finish is spicy and dry with peppery notes. Complex and tasty.

Draft. Nose is light citrus. Lemon sort of. Some perfume like coriander. Hazy straw pour. Taste is great. A soft vanilla sweetness with light candi sugar. Like circus peanuts. Lightly phenolic I the finish, some light esters. Very nice.
Cloudy orange Amber with rimming beige head aroma is mild funk with woody spice tomato sauce; flava is funky woody yeasty some banana oregano feels light with slight fizz tang finishes dry bitter
Draft. This has an odd yeast note, it is very yeast, rubbery, mundane, malt body is weird and off-kilter. Not a great brew.

Bottle from City Beer SF. Amber color, white head. Bitter taste with citrus, earthy notes, yeast, hops, grass, wheat and ripe fruits. Bitter finish with citrus, yeast, ripe fruits, yeast, wheat and grass. Excellent brew.
On draft. Clear golden orange pour, with a white head. Bready, grain, hay, herbal hops, notes of fruit, and pear.

Pours hazy copper/amber with a thick creamy off-white head. Stays long; thick, sticky lacing. Nose is earthy with spice notes, crackers, and soft floral hops. Flavor is quite sweet with pear-like notes. Trails off to a light and dry spicy hop finish. Full body. Lively carbonation. Another worthy brew from Allagash.

Bottle: Poured a clear golden color ale with a large foamy head with good retention and some lacing. Aroma of nice cereal notes with light herbal hops notes is quite pleasant. Taste is a good mix of cereal notes with some herbal hops notes with light residual sugar notes. Body is full with good carbonation. Another well-made and easily drinkable beer from a brewery that really masters Belgian style beers.

Caged & Corked bottle from Julios. Dated 4-14-16. Poured into a tulip. Huge pillowy off white head with a cloudy light burnt orange hue. Complex yeasty aromas. Flavor is dry with herbal mixed berry and fruit with spicy bitterness. Long light citrus spice finish.
Robust fruit and yeast aroma. Lightly hazy golden color with a medium white head. Moderately sweet throughout with a mild Belgian bitterness in the finish. Creamy palate.

From a corked bottle. Gold with head and lace. Aroma of sweet scones, grains, Fall grass. Significant carbonation and mouthfeel. Flavors of grains, pale malts, slight Steens cane syrup, hay, straw hops, field herbs. Overall rich, unique and very flavorful.
Bottle. Amber beer with a big cream head. Grapefruit and yeast aroma. Citrus and yeast flavor with spice. Medium bodied. Spice and yeast lingers with light citrus.
From a bottle purchased at the brewery. Pours a clear gold with a thick off white head. Herbal nose. Flavors of Belgian yeast with some mint and caramel. Very tasty.

UPDATED: DEC 19, 2016 Big bottle from Portland maine enjoyed in minny with commonmac . Hazy gold orange with a little sediment. Aroma is Belgian yeast with high tartness. Taste is spicy , sweet, nice Belgian type flavor . Some spice bitterness late. Very good.
Pours a burnt golden orange color with a thick white head. Yeast, funk, spice, fruit and biscuit aroma and flavors. Medium body and lively carbonation with a yeast, fruit and spice finish.

From bottle, courtesy of Karl. Nice musky estery aroma, yeasty funk. Hazy pale golden with white lacing head. Medium body with medium-high carbonation. Sweet almost like a tripel, with yeast esters and spicy undertones. Mild bitter finish and sweet yeasty after.

750 ml bottle from Pearl Street Beverage in Burlington, VT, served at cellar temp in a Duvel glass. Gotta get some other big glasses for these big fluffy things...anyway it pours out a huge snow-white frothy head which diminishes gradually to a lasting moderate-sized ring with chunky lacing, atop a cloudy, semi-opaque gold-amber body...the nose is yeasty and redolent of brown or Belgian candy sugar, a hint of ginger and soft sweet breads...on the tongue its lightly to moderately sweet, a bit peppery right from the get-go, bready/doughy but not flabby if you get my meaning, and just a bit tart as it edges towards a slightly dry and quite long finish...the mouthfeel is supple and velvety, super-soft, with soft but strong carbonation, making for an absolutely compulsively drinkable beer that betrays little sign of its alcohol. This is right in my wheelhouse when it comes to a moderately strong, balanced Belgian ale and I really miss being able to get this brewerys special and seasonal releases right now.

Bottle at home. Pours hazy orange with a large, thick creamy off-white head, long retention with good lacing. Aroma is moderate earthy Belgian yeast spices, cracker malt, oats and earthy wheat with soft esters underneath and spicy, lightly floral hops. Flavor is crisp wheat, oats and cracker malt, earthy Belgian yeast spices, soft pear esters, medium-light spicy hops and bitterness with a dry finish. Full body and moderate carbonation.

750 mL bottle from Wine Warehouse, 5/30/16. Hazy orange, large foamy tan head, good retention. Aroma of almost bretty yeast, oats, pineapple, citrus. The taste is pineapple, yeast, pale malt, citrus, oats. Medium bodied, well balanced, moderately high carbonation. Very nice.
Sample at Answer. Yellow with nice head. Banana aroma with some dry floral and white pepper. A little dry.
Pours golden orange with a white soapy head. Aroma of lemon, spice, and wheat. Lemon flavor with oats, spice, and some grapefruit. Dry finish. Very nice beer!

Hazy golden orange, mild white head. Sweet citrus and coriander. Some mild grain. Stronger spicy and bitter taste upfront, mellows out later into a nice sweetness. Fairly oily, medium body. Mild carbonation. Long finish. Excellent.

Hazy golden color; Medium body; Aroma of malt, yeast, floral/fruit, & some spice; Flavor of sweet malt, yeast, floral hops, nice fruit/citrus, and some caramel; Dry finish; Nicely balanced; Definite fruity - pretty decent.

750 ml bottle purchase at Hunger Mountain Coop in Montpelier (VT) on September 28, 2016. Honey orange, medium head. Spicy orange and sweet herbs aroma, quite fresh. Taste of fresh orchard fruit and spicy herbs, nice malt character, dry bitterness. This is Maine Beer!
Sample at Avondale beer growler. Spicy and crisp. A little herbal and spicy yeast on the finish. Fruity mid palate. Yeast and grain are the story here though.

Sampler at the great lost bear. Pours golden with a white head. Leaves a lot of lacing in the glass. Nice Belgian yeast notes on the nose. A bit of juicy fruit on the tongue. Clean finisher. Solid example of style. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at tasting event. Pours hazy straw gold. Aroma and flavor are rustic grain bill with some toasted and hay notes, floral and grassy hop notes, peppery notes, and some farmhouse yeast esters. Medium body.
Lovely, lively. I would call it a Belgian pale. Many notes similar to a tripel, but more balanced: banana, honey, bread/cereal, lemony herb. Dry, perfectly bottle conditined, and delicious.
Gold pour with frothy white head and lace. Aroma is horse blanket and hay. Flavor is flat wheat and perfumy notes. Medium body with nice aggressive carbonation. Solid

Bottle, caged and corked. This is an exceptional concept, and I love the opening salvo with the pop of the cork and the pour -- flawless. From there, we get to the subjective points. IMHO, this ultimately is a wild beer, with a wild-fermented character, and a farmhouse funk. It starts out slow for me, but as it grows on me, I enjoy it more. The brewers description is actually quite spot-on, which isnt all that common. I concur with the "lemon rind, flowers ... herbal hop notes, wheat cracker ... and dry finish." Good schtuff. (#6341, 9/23/2016)
Pours a light gold with a thick white head. Aroma of banana, clove, pineapple and grain. Taste follows, finishes dry and peppery. This is near perfection
Aromas of lemon zest, floral notes, clove, some bubble gum. Hazy orange with a lasting white head. Pretty dry, cereal, floral, grassy. Medium bodied, fluffy.

Pours a finger of head on a hazy straw body.
Aroma is lemon zest, orange and a little earth. Nice.
Taste is dirt, herbal, mild lemon bitter and dry finish.
Texture is a little chalky.
Enjoyable.

Pours a medium golden color with three fingers of billowing foam. Nose is nice blend of doughy malts, toasted grain, complex yeast esters and nice citrus hop profile. Palate follows with some nice grain structure, balanced hop flavors that interplay nicely with the spicy belgian yeast profile. Touch of honey sweetness keeps the bitter herbal notes in check and a lingering citrus zip cleans up the finish nicely !
Bottle. Pours golden yellow with a short white head. Aroma was floral with citrus, yeast, herbs and lemon zest. Flavor of pale malts, citrus, lemon, floral, yeast, herbs and had notes of funk.
delicious terrific lace. not noteable aroma. some lemon. belgian yeast and unobtrusive. hoppy. absolute delight uncoomon.

Bottle. Pours hazy orange-brown with a frothy to creamy, white, lasting head that leaves scant lacing. Aroma of cloves and pine. Flavors of green apples, yeasty, sourdough, clove and caramel, medium sour, lightly sweet, medium body, too much carbo, and a medium sour finish.

Refrigerated 75 cl brown bottle corked and capped poured into a tulip. Hazy orange with huge white head. Aroma is orangey yeast, medium body, medium carbonation, and little lacing. Taste is yeasty and some orange.

Bottle from Capitol Beer & Tap Room. Pours cloudy golden with a huge white head and a floral fruity aroma. There is a hearty pale malt flavor with a little banana ester and a fairly bitter finish. Refreshing and tasty.

Bottle. Pours a medium hazy gold, small but persistent head. Aroma of mild to medium funk, citrus, floral and earthy notes, and some spice (think white pepper and a hint of clove). Flavor matches, held together by a background of crackery pale malt. Really nice.

On tap at the brewery. Pours orange with fluffy white head and nice lacing. Aroma is of funky yeast, bready malt, fruit and some candy sugar. Body is full and crisp. Earthy hops, funky yeast, pale malt, candy sugar and fruit fill the mouth. Finish is long and bitter. Interesting brew.

Draught @ Stags Head. Cloudy bright orange with small foamy off-white head, faint vanilla aroma, medium carbonation, typical Belgian yeast taste, a bit salty, thin body, long vanilla flavored finish. Very good example of the genre.
Tap at Harrys in San Jose. Pouts slightly hazy deep yellow with full white head. Both aroma and flavor tilt to grapefruit rind, with slight lemon in flavor. Cracker malt gives modest support.

Bouteille de 750 ml, avec bouchon de liège, partagée lors dune dégustation entre amis. Arôme: Odeur de céréales et de levures avec une pointe dhoublon. Apparence: La couleur est orangée légèrement voilée. Présence dun mince col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Léger goût dagrumes et de gomme baloune avec une pointe de céréales. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement onctueuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Légère présence de gomme baloune en arrière goût. (Rating #7003)

750 ml bottle. Pours a slightly hazy copper golden with a thick, resilient white head. Aroma is lemon, cinnamon, grapefruit and honey. Flavor is grass, cereal, lemon, lime, grapefruit, dusty and oldish. Finish is lemon, grass, peach and pear. Lingering lemon kick and bubble gum. Medium body, average carbonation.
750 ml bottle. Pours a deep orange. Wit like with yeasty notes. Some floral taste. Orange. Nice.
On tap at Capones. Poured a hazy golden color with a smaller sized head. Citrus, some fruitiness, and a little herbal.
Shared bottle. Pours a somewhat cloudy golden red with a decent white head. Aroma of yeast, fruit, and grain. Taste is lemon, yeast, grain, malt, and spice. Nice.

Bomber from Whole Foods Market Fair Lakes
Aroma: citrus, floral, Belgian yeast
Appearance: clear golden with a white head
Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, 
Palate: medium body, sticky, average carbonation, long finish, 

delicious
Nice deep amber. Aroma of light citrus, maybe lemon, some herbal notes. Taste has more malt presence. I like the concept more than execution.

Earthy yeast, hay, straw, Grass, lightly citric, whiff of alcohol, layered and refined.
Amber colour, big white head, lacing.
Noticably sweet, medium bite, yeasty and With a good amount of grapefruity hops.
Medium/fullbodied, thick feel, bitter finish.
My first from allagash and it did impress.
Golden colored, moderate to large head, good lace/retention. Aroma is pale malt, yeast, lightly spiced, light wheat. Medium to light body, quite drinkable, nicely balanced but completely forgettable.

Taster pour at Sierra Nevada Beer Camp Across America. Appearance is cloudy, medium yellow with finger width foamy white head. Aroma is tart Belgian yeast dominant over nice fruity esters. Taste is strong sweet citrus, banana, and fruit along with clove. Palate is medium bodied with thick texture and soft carbonation and sweet/tart mix finish. Overall, this is strong in every way a Belgian Ale should be.

Location: 750 ml bottle from Hoboken Vine, 6/20/16. 


Aroma: Aroma is floral, herbal, and wheaty, with some spice, lemon rind, and yeast

Appearance: Pours a murky orange color with a frothy off-white head and some sticky lacing. Lacing sticks around for a while, and the head hardly dissipates at all while it sits in the glass. 

Flavor: Taste reminds me of Belgian beer, lots of yeast flavors, spice, and fruit present. 

Palate: Drinks nicely, lively. Creamy mouthfeel. Finishes with a spicy, dry tingle to it.

Overall Impression: 
This one comes off as both drinkable and complex. Theres a lot going on here, but the whole combination works. Enjoyed it quite a bit.

Pours light golden with a foamy white head. Wheat aroma, with light citrus zest, herbal yeast, and slight clove. Flavor starts with light crisp wheat, Lemon, floral notes and finishes with grapefruit, a herbal yeastiness and faint cloves.

My Bottom Line:
A complex interplay of cereals, esters (bananas, pears), phenols and herbal hops is taken into earthiness and subtle bitterness.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A sizeable head of foam tops the misty straw gold.
-Drinkability is relatively high.
-The nose has a lot going on.
-The yeast character behaves in a unique fashion in the presence of this grain bill. This brew might even have terroir. It doesnt recall anything I know, flavor and aroma-wise.

Bottle.
Fecal hay and farmhouse funk nose, pear underneath. Cloudy amber, thick sticky head. Hay, funk, bitter grass. Medium body, waxy, low carbonation. Seems a bit listless.

Pours deep gold into a tulip. Bright white head with excellent retention recedes to coat surface. Coriander and hay aromas. Soft and sweet with yeast, clove and caramel front to back. Lasting sweet honey finish.

Sample poured at Allagash. The pour is s darker golden yellow with a thick white head that falls to a thick collar leaving incredible amounts of lace in its wake. The aroma is good. There is a very bready malt and a hint of spiciness to it, but it smells like a decent Belgian ale. Its not enough to deter me, so thats saying something. The flavor is better. There is a nice lemongrassiness to this that is really good. It keeps me interested. The traditional maltiness and spice of a Belgian are there, but the lemongrass keeps it interesting. The mouth feel is again, a bit thicker than one would expect. The carbonation is soft and keeps this lingering around for quite some time. Malty, spicy, and lightly grassy on the finish. Its not too bad.

Flight at Allagash with koleminer20. Aroma is fruity, dry, clove, robust, really nice. Appearance is golden amber, clear, white head. Taste is dry, robust, banana, clove, full flavored. Mouthfeel is light to medium body, light carbonation, dry robust aftertaste. Overall, this one is solid.

On tap at the Brewery with Patty. Nice cloudy Orange color. Taste is of wheat, lemon and citrus and sweet honey malt Flavor. Medium body with nice crisp carbonation. Patty said it was close to her favorite beer... Blue Moon. She enjoyed it.
Sample at WOBFest 2016. Loving the combination of the traditional ale plum flavor with the citrus aftertaste of grapefruit and lemon. They really know how to brew in Maine.
Draft at Craft. Hazy straw pour with off-white head. Nose was wheaty malt, hops, grapefruit. Tasted floral, wheaty, with some funk, hops, grapefruit, and white peppery notes. Complex and enjoyable.

UPDATED: AUG 24, 2016 Draft at Moriartys in June 2016 during an outdoor event and again at Bru Craft in August. Very hazy fizzy golden orange pour with lasting soapy soft white foam. Nice full lace. Huge carbonation. Bitter tropical fruits. Citrusy caramel malts. Earthy florals. Grains of paradise. Orange shortbread. Dried lemons. Celery seed. Peppery crackers. Unusual but not extraordinary.

The Ginger Man, NYC tap: pours orange with a frothy white head. Ara is yeast, berries, herbs, and bread. Taste is kind of sweet. Low bitterness. Spice and herbs. Mellow fruitiness. Yeast. Many positive taste. Allagash does not disappoint.

On tap at the Bagg in W Conshy, PA. Pours a moderate/medium brown with three inches of frothy white head. Nice earthy Belgian aroma. Mouthfeel is moderate and creamy with a tint of dryness just at the end. Taste is a subdued Belgian flavor. Not sweet and not dry, but in the middle. Should have had a bit more flavor. Otherwise, Allagash knows how to brew these suckers.... for a hefty price.

Malt aroma with some fruity hops and some medicinal hops. Taste is full bodied malty with dry tropical and medicinal hop finish, slight earthy funk, with some Belgian yeasty flavors (but not as much as a normal Belgian ale). Almost a peppery finish. Descent beer but I would put is a average overall. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

750ml bottle pours a hazy orange copper color with a large lacy white head. Big Belgian yeast aroma, barnyard, peppery, floral, grapefruit, lemon, grains of paradise. Dry flavor, medium bitter, sticks with you. The feel is quite nice, as the gash typically is. Dessicating and effervescent. A good brewski.
Bottle at home. Dirty orange pour big head. Nose is floral and honey. Tastes of nice honey, tangerine, florals, crackers, berry, some earthiness. Sweet and bitter somehow. Fine palate. Enjoyable.

Form the corked, caged 750 ml. bottle. Bottled 3/24/16. The pour is a cloudy amber-yellow with a lingering white head. Toasted bread on the nose along with lemon zest, fruitiness, grass, clove, and coriander. Medium to full body. Mildly sweet bready taste with the fruity characteristics of the nose juicing it up to a zesty yet dry finish. I wish I had tried 2014 and 2015.

Gold color, clear.
Yeasty, earthy nose.
Medium/full body, moderate flavor, smooth mouthfeel, avg length.
Bitter, dry but not excessively.
Hoppy, fruity.
OK.


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottled 3/24/16 and drunk 5/12/16 and again 5/22/16.Lovely copper appearance shows good clarity, as would be expected. Lighter golden and deeper amber tints are visible, with a big, off-white head atop showing strong retention.Lush, estery nose provides all sorts of various fruits; apple, pear, strawberry and so forth. Theres a deep cereal/grain character that is both clean and wonderfully well-developed. Wheat bread, biscuit, very light raisin and notes of that nature, mix with the esters pretty harmoniously adding a more earthy character to the light fruits. Not hugely phenolic, but with herbal/peppery hops to that end, which are reserved but still aromatic, leading to an earthy, lightly herbal finish replete with hints of floral notes. No alcohol noted.At first I dont notice it, but as Chris points out, this is actually fairly bitter in flavor. Certainly not overly so, but its a good complement to all of the malty notes, which provide only light to moderate sweetness, being well-attenuated. Herbs, floral notes and more earthy/grainy malts on the end, with ample, tight carbonation and a medium-soft, malty-to-grainy texture overall with no alcohol or flaw. More citrus character emerging as it warms and breathes, but I dont think it ever runs rampant and keeps the beer crisp and refreshing in the face of all of the malt/wheat/oat character.

75CL, Thanks AFH. snifter, a good looking beer, brownish gold. This smells really nice. very herbal, a stout buckwheat, cloves and tangerine. Good carb. thin tiny bubbles, taste is similar to the smell except it loses the citrus as far as I can tell. very bitter finish.

750 ml bottle, 2016 vintage. I purchased this at Prost, North Hampton. Color is a hazy orange, this only had light head around the snifter. Aroma is hazy honey, Belgian yeast, straw. 
Honey / pale malt base with a huge spicy yeast character. The sweet honey malt is balanced by the black pepper / spice in the finish. House yeast is pretty noticeable. Medium body with nice crisp carbonation. Pretty nice.

On tap at MIT Science Bar as part of ECBT. Entire crew present. Pint glass. Attractive unfiltered appearance with a beautiful combination of orange and gold. Aroma is reminiscent of a strong farmhouse ale. Slightly sweet and funky. Taste is very solid and interesting. Makes you thirst for another one almost instantly. Familiar yet new. Nice Belgian yeast impact. Spices playing a role as well. Coriander, earthy notes. This feels like a really good Belgian IPA crossed with a lighter farmhouse ale. Definitely my favorite of the trip this far. Ill travel through at least 16 counties to imbibe on this beer again.

Bottle from Berts
Slightly hazy deep golden color with a huge bubbly white head that persists forever. Earthy fruity Spicy cereal grain and wheat berries. Mild yeasty esters. Pretty tasty beer.

Sampled at mile, pours clear gold with no head and not much lacing. Notes of banana, clove, coriander bubblegum and other yeasty and estery Belgian notes. Medium bodied. Way too spiced and boring for me. This would have been good with some more hops or a bright herb with some citrus behind it

On tap at Vermont tap house. 
This was poured into a tulip. 
The appearance was a hazy burnt orange color with a slim bar pours kind of white head. Moderate rimmed/ringy lacing clings to the glass. 
The smell had some sweet Belgian sugars up front. Light lemon - semi-sweet, some orange peel, light spice - coriander.
The taste was sweet backed up nicely by the coriander. Slight Belgian sweet malty aftertaste. Quick semi-sweet to dry finish. 
On the palate, this one sat about a light to medium on the body with a nice sipping quality about it. Carbonation felt light allowing some stickiness but nothing overbearing. 
Overall, really nice Belgian Strong pale ale. Id have again.
Bottle. Golden pour with tan head. Herbal, yeast, saison aromas. Light sweet Flavors, citrus, herbal, grassy and yeast.
Bottle - pours yellow white head- nose and taste of grapefruit, citrus bubblegum- med body

Draft. Small off-white head atop hazy light amber body. Aroma is medium sweet, spicy, some citrus, light bread. Taste is medium sweet, orange, some spicy, light lemon. Light-medium body, low carbonation.

UPDATED: MAY 8, 2016 Great belgian beer. I don?t know why this brewery isn?t in Brussels. Florals and light citrus. Some resin. Golden blonde pour with foamy head. Sweet finish. Bottle from whole foods.

Bottle from Brewtopia. Hazy orange gold with lasting head and lace. Complex aroma of mango grapefruit spice wheat tang honey hard candy. Mango honey sweetness with wheaty tang and umami (?). Herbal spicy bitterness with some citrus in fairly dry finish. Medium body with wicked soft carbo. Best mouthfeel of a beer that I have had in ages. Excellent. Wish I could do a better job describing it.

4 oz pour on draft at B Side after the DC RateBeer Tasting. 2016 release. Slightly hazy golden orange with off-white head. Aromas of funk and citrus. Tastes of hay, funk, light citrus. Medium-light body with a dry finish.
This poured a golden yellow draught from rustico, refreshign floral notes, some hops notes and some serious but balanced hops. Really nice.

Smells of lemongrass and thats it. Nice cloudy Orange color. Taste is watery then changes to sweet honey malt Flavor. Medium body with nice crisp carbonation. This makes me want to try more from you guys. Nice work!

Golden in color with thin white head... Aroma of peppers, apricots, citrus, grains... Flavor is peppery and biscuity, some light fruity notes, light earthy hop notes... Delicious

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap. Creamy cappuccino white head, bright hazy coppery orange hue. Sweet berries, hay, earthy Brett thats light, light fruits, and an unmistakable Allagash yeast character in the aroma. Flavor mirrors the aroma closely, quite fruity all around, pear, red apple meat, light leather, slight hay notes. Veering on a medium body with tiny bright, yet soft carbonation.

Part of a sampler at the brewery. Pours amber with a lacy, white head. Aroma of spicy yeast, some floral notes, light malts with some caramel sweetness, and hints of light fruit. Flavor the same with a nice blend. Average texture. A solid Belgian beer from Allagash.

Draft at B Side. Poured a hazy golden color, with a white head. Aroma is strong floral hop notes, light citrus. Light sweetness dominates this delicate beer, with a very light funky character to it. Creamy mouthfeel. Delicious.

Draft at Partisan, courtesy of staff, thanks! Hazy golden color, white head with good retention and solid lacing. Very perfumy and floral aroma. Taste has glowers, haystacks, meadows, light barnyard. Delicious.

Draught at the brewery during the tour.
APPEARANCE: darker blond beer.
NOSE: malty, fruity, quite sweet.
TASTE: some hops, fruity, quite sweet.
